t: Amazon
s: I’d seriously think about your packaging through - at least put a sticker on the box reminding/warning people to be careful when opening them. ... Don’t pack delicate fabrics/textiles or things easily cut in a box that needs sharp implements to open, use a bag to send them instead?

t: Open Box Inspection - Amazon Customer Service
s: With Open Box Inspection, the delivery associate will unpack your order package at the time of delivery for your inspection.

t: Return Items You Ordered - Amazon Customer Service
s: You can return many eligible items sold on Amazon.com. When you return an item, you may see different return options depending on the seller, item, or reason for return.

t: Returns - Amazon Customer Service
s: If you need to return or replace an item, visit Your Orders and select 'Return or Replace Items' on the relevant order. You can find help topics on this page such as how to replace broken and missing items, returning your order, and how to resolve refund issues.

t: Free Returns on Fashion Items - Amazon Customer Service
s: We offer free returns on some fashion items including clothes, shoes, handbags, jewelry, and watches. Look for Free returns next to the price to confirm that the item qualifies for free returns.

t: Damaged or Defective Item - Amazon Customer Service
s: All our products go through intense quality check before they are shipped. However, in rare instances a product may get damaged during transit. Read below for Frequently Asked Questions about damaged or defective products.

t: Does it matter if the packaging is a bit damaged when returning a product? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 4): The product will be returned to the original manufacturer through the supply chain with the relevant information so they can fix what went wrong with the product that was delivered to you..
